comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Prince of Wales visited President Fallieres in the Elysee Palace in April 1912. See query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=990DE4DD1E3CE633A... from April 3, 1912 Another article, from April 14, 1912, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9907E4DF103AE633A... "PRINCE PUZZLES DANDIES.; Paris Exquisites Find Cut of Wales's Coats Varies from Day to Day. PARIS, April 13. -- Remembering that King Edward VII. was the arbiter elegantiarum for the French capital the present generation of Parisian dandies have been anxiously scrutinizing the young Prince of Wales since his arrival, with the result that just now they are in a curious dilemma."

comment.author: 48232334@N03
comment._content: I lived in paris in the days when you could get quite close to it - I was shooed away by a policeman from the actual pavement running along the wall - sacre bleu!
